New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers achieved a 9-0 start, the best in their 55-year history.
They set a new record with a field goal percentage of 52.6% and scored 110 points or more in each of their first nine games.
Key Match Events: They defeated the New Orleans Pelicans 131-122 to reach the historic 9-0 record.
Pre-Game Insights: The team was highlighted for their defense and efficient offense leading up to the game against the Golden State Warriors.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Kenny Atkinson celebrated the win by having a water shower in the locker room, acknowledging the team's consistency and effort.
Donovan Mitchell emphasized teamwork and consistency after the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers' performance was compared to the 1960-61 Golden State Warriors, who also achieved a similar feat.
